column5: We are traveling to Lake of the Woods for the first time during the second week of August and staying in a cabin on the south end of Basil Channel. Does anyone have any tips on fishing this area. We are primarily fishing walleyes and bass. Any ideas about what to expect, hotspots, or baits? Thanks
Anniez Are you renting the cabin from a resort?

Call the resort and talk with Rick Gates. He should be able to give you some tips. His family runs BVR and he guides out of BVR. Speaking from my experience, motoring from BVR to Basil Channel can be a really rough ride if you have a strong south wind.

BV is a long ride from Basil with a wind. There are plenty of walleye closer to the resort. Any of the main lake reefs on the map will hold fish on nicer days. Wind swept shore points will hold fish on windy days. Watch what the wind does and locate current through neckdowns and those will hold fish also.
